metadata.title: CVE-2021-21154 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap buffer overflow in Tab Strip in Google Chrome prior to 88.0.4324.182allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process topotentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
